sermons.title: (Hebrews) 8-Faith
sermons.description: This final message summarizes and recapitulates the entire series in a sweeping biblical survey showing that without faith it is impossible to please God, but all things are possible to him who believes!

sermons.title: (Luke) 25 - The Stormy Sea
sermons.description: What is faith?  What does it mean to really believe?  The stormy sea is Jesus' "lab" that followed the lecture on the parable of the sower.  Many times the Lord does great things in our lives not because we have great faith but to encourage us in the little faith that we have.

sermons.title: A Crisis Of Faith
sermons.description: May 16, 2004 - We are facing in the Church of Jesus Christ a crisis of faith. The hardest part of faith is the last half hour and just before the victory we give up turning away from God with a evil heart of unbelief. God will lead us into places where we are shut up and nothing short of a miracle will get us out of the situation. It is in these places of hopeless crisis that God will come through to glorify His name. We must stand on the promises of God with a heart full of faith declaring that God is faithful. Pastor Wilkerson examines the lives of Saul, Solomon and Samson as men of God who went into a crises of faith and failed the test. Our faith will be tried, as by fire. If your faith is being tested, you should listen carefully to this message.

sermons.title: A Declaration of the Faith - Part 6
sermons.description: The true faith exposes the end-time apostasy, which is producing "Christian" lawlessnes. It opposes amusements and entertainments. The faith is safe, sound security that is conditional. The faith is opposed to any involvement in witchcraft, yet believes in the miraculous. The faith is expressed in modesty and simplicity. The faith is unity in the true body of Christ.

sermons.title: A Faith That Does Not Save
A Working Faith: Arrogant Presumption Exposed
All Things Are Possible To Him That Believes
By Faith
sermons.description: Just as the Galatians began by faith, then foolishly leaned back toward the works of the flesh, we too can be tempted to "methods" as we practice the Word of God. The danger is to become principle oriented and lose sight of the God of the principles. This message exhorts us to live BY FAITH.

sermons.title: Childlike Faith (4 of 4)
sermons.description: We believe that these messages truly flesh out what is meant by the phrase, 'We walk by faith, not by sight.' Because 'faith' is so easily misunderstood this is a much needed truth.

sermons.title: Complete Faith
sermons.description: Discussed here is the unregenerate soul; natural man, or animal man as Major Thomas describes man without Christ.

sermons.title: Extraordinary Faith
sermons.description: Pastor Cymbala presents examples of Jesus performing miracles by honoring the faith of others. After hearing this short teaching, we hope you will be driven to pray for the needs of others. John 4:46-51; Mark 2:1-6

sermons.title: Faith Made Complete
sermons.description: An expository teaching on James 2, covering the subjects of partiality and of faith and works. Partiality is showing preference to someone we feel comfortable around. Faith works. Very practical definitions are given to each of these subjects.

sermons.title: Faith To Leave The Gas Station
sermons.description: We are reminded here that we can have all the Biblical knowledge possible, yet still be empty.  You must have a personal relationship with Jesus to go out and serve Him. He uses a lot of Scripture confirming this and also shares how one can find such a relationship with Christ.

sermons.title: Faith, New Birth, Witness of the Spirit
Footsteps in the Hallway
sermons.description: April 29, 2007 - When we live outside of the boundaries of God’s Word we will end up with a life of fruitless religion, and a manmade covering. The true life of Christ will be shut off to every man or woman who comes through Christ through human effort and human intellect. What we could never accomplish in a lifetime, God did in one day by sending His son to be a covering for all of our sins and to empower us to glorify His name through the Holy Spirit. At the end of your life you want to be sure that it is God’s footsteps coming to take you home with Him.

sermons.title: God's School of Faith
sermons.description: God builds our faith and strengthens us through hard times and difficult moments. He wants to make us into sons and daughters He can trust and who will bless others. Joshua 24:1-4

sermons.title: Great Faith Over Great Fear - Psalm 46
Hebrews 11:23-33
sermons.description: il

sermons.title: Heroes In Hebrews
sermons.description: *poor tape quality

sermons.title: How much can you lose without losing your faith
I Can't Take It
sermons.description: In this study, Pastor Cymbala takes us to the Old Testament and we learn that bad things can happen when God's people loose their faith. Num 13:25-14:4; I Corinth 10:6,10; Phil 2:14-15 (GNT)

sermons.title: II Peter - How Firm is your Faith?
Making It Over The Last Mountain
Personal Discoveries In the Faith Life
Reach out in faith and expect confidently
Special Faith
sermons.description: This is the final message from the Brooklyn Tabernacle's special week of prayer. In this teaching, you will be encouraged to seek God for increased faith to better serve Him in 2016. Acts 3:11-16 (NIV)

sermons.title: The Cosmic Setting
sermons.description: The faith is set in the context of a cosmic perspective, presently so lacking in the understanding of contemporary church life.  Another unique expression of this timeless theme.

sermons.title: The Day the Sun Stood Still
The Principle of Faith
sermons.description: For us to experience the supernatural intervention of God, such as answers to prayer we must have faith. The amount of bible knowledge will not help us, we need the faith to believe God is able and He needs to be our confidence. If we can comprehend everything and can do things in our own strength, there is no need to have faith and rely on God. God wants to do more but we must believe.

sermons.title: The Proof Of Faith
sermons.description: nil

sermons.title: The Ups And Downs Of Faith
sermons.description: As Christians, walking the life of faith, we have ups and downs in our faith and can learn lessons from Abraham's experiences. 1-Abraham succeeding in his faith 2-Abraham falling in his faith 3-Abraham being renewed in his faith

sermons.title: The eye is faith, and the light is His presence
Trusting God Again Like A Child
Turn Your Eyes Upon Jesus
sermons.description: This sermon clearly shows us through God's word that when trials and temptations come, Jesus Christ is the “way,” the “truth,” and the “life”. Each of these aspects of the life of Christ is brought out in a deeper way through this message. When difficult times come and you seem to be in stormy weather, just “turn your eyes upon Jesus.”

sermons.title: What Is Faith - Part 1
sermons.description: The Bible is mean to be heard, accepted but beyond all of that it is to be obeyed. True faith is taught by Manley Beasley as obedient faith. He shares great truths on this subject and from Jesus's teachings.

sermons.title: What Is Faith - Part 2
sermons.description: Faith is not a leap into the dark but a leap into the light. Manley Beasley continues his teaching on faith as a necessary element of the Christian Life. And clears up many wrong teachings on faith. And how to trust Jesus and put your faith in Him for your walk with Him.

sermons.title: When You Would Rather Die Then Live
When the Unseen Becomes Visible
sermons.description: December 20, 2009 - This message is for those who know the right thing to do but find that you are powerless to do so. It’s for: dishonest people who want to trust God but don’t know how, selfish people that want to be generous, wounded hearts that want to let go and forgive, and the verbally abusive who have a desire to speak with kind words. How do we get free from this? How do we experience peace on earth and goodwill towards man? The answer is the gift of Jesus. God in the flesh burst forth into the visible because humanity had no way out! This is the message of Christmas. He came with a display of compassion for our weaknesses and nailed them to a Tree. The good news is that Jesus forgives our sin and enables us to live a life that is pleasing to Him and those around us.

sermons.title: Without Faith It Is Impossible to Please God
